JUST IN: Capitol South Metro station is now reopened after police investigated stabbing on the platform. The victim is a teenage male who is undergoing surgery and is in critical condition. @ABC7Kevin @tomrousseyABC7 https://wjla.com/news/local/juvenile-stabbing-capitol-south-metro-station

UPDATE: DC Police Chief told us 15 year old stabbing victim is in very critical condition and in surgery right now. They believe he was stabbed on an Orange Line train, got off at the Capitol South Metro station, and collapsed near the turnstile. Mayor declined to speak about it.   at Capitol South Metro Station

Metro Transit Police said Capitol South Station is likely to remain closed "for some time," as authorities investigate a stabbing that occurred Friday afternoon. Metro is advising commuters to use the Federal Center SW or Eastern Market stations.

Update: Investigators believe the incident began with an altercation aboard a Metro train. The victim was stabbed, approached the station manager s booth at Capitol South & collapsed. Shaw-Howard (1/3): Approx 1:08 p.m., MTPD & MPD responded for report of gunshots at the station. Confirmed shooting occurred on platform following argument btwn individuals believed to be known to each other. One victim transported w/ non-life-threatening injury. wmata
